page.title: 03Upton St. Leonard's Church
page.content: The original church was built in Norman times on a Saxon site. Over the years many alterations and additions have taken place. The seating accommodation is for 380 people with the exception for the 24 choirsters. The church is often full when special events like school concerts take place. As the population increase more and more people of Upton need the services of the church. In 1984 26 babies were christenend, 25 couples were married and there were 20 funerals. The sunday services are usually at 8 and 10 a.m and there is a ceremony at 6.30 p.m. In the summer months on a Tuesday evening there is a very popular family service where members of the Scouts, Cubs, Guides and Brownies parade with their flags and in which very young people take part.
